title: Building a Bottle Trap for Mice and Voles
brief: Create a simple pitfall trap for small rodents using natural digging and camouflage.
steps: Step 1: Dig a hole 30-45 cm deep that is wider at the bottom than at the top.
Step 2: Make the top opening as small as possible while still allowing target animals to fall through.
Step 3: Ensure the walls slope backward so animals cannot climb out once they fall in.
Step 4: Place a piece of bark or wood over the hole as cover.
Step 5: Support the cover 2.5-5 cm off the ground using small stones as props.
Step 6: Position near areas where mice and voles are active.
warnings: Check trap with extreme caution - it makes an excellent hiding place for snakes.
Backward-sloping walls are essential or animals will climb out easily.
Cover must be stable enough not to collapse but light enough for animals to hide under.
